result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald L Hansen

records.addlTxt:
9:25 AM Defendant Ronald L Hansen in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Ronald L Hansen.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests time for more investigation.
Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:37 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Ronald L Hansen in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Ronald L Hansen. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:38 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Ronald L Hansen in court. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on August 5, 2022.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant is not to be located on the premises of the complex in Muskego where Victim A/Victim B reside.

03:22 PM Defendant Ronald L Hansen in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nimmer notes the Public Defender's Office is still trying to figure out whether the defendant qualifies with his spouse's income.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
